question.title: How to log only the root cause exception from a Spring Kafka @KafkaListener?
question.body:
I am using Spring Kafka, and when an exception is thrown inside my @KafkaListener method, it gets wrapped by Spring Kafka exceptions. This makes my logs very difficult to read and analyze.

The Problem

For example, if my application code throws a CustomException, the final log output shows a nested stack trace like this:

ERROR: org.springframework.kafka.listener.TimestampedException: Exception thrown at 2025-10-23T10:30:45
    at ...
Caused by: org.springframework.kafka.listener.ListenerExecutionFailedException: Listener failed
    at ...
Caused by: com.project.exception.CustomException: [The actual application error message]
    at com.project.service.OrderService.process(OrderService.java:42)
    at ...

This log is noisy. The most important information, the CustomException, is buried at the bottom. The top-level exceptions (TimestampedException, ListenerExecutionFailedException) hide the real application error and make it hard to see the root cause at a glance.

Desired Outcome

I want to configure my error handler to log only the root cause exception. My ideal log output for the same error would be clean and simple:

ERROR: com.project.exception.CustomException: [The actual application error message]
    at com.project.service.OrderService.process(OrderService.java:42)
    at ...

My Question

What is the best way to configure Spring Kafka's error handling to achieve this?

Any advice or examples would be appreciated. Thank you!

answers.body:
You could configure custom error handler. For example

import org.slf4j.Logger;
import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
import org.springframework.core.NestedExceptionUtils;
import org.springframework.kafka.listener.CommonErrorHandler;
import org.springframework.kafka.listener.CommonLoggingErrorHandler;

@Configuration
public class KafkaErrorHandlerConfig {

    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(KafkaErrorHandlerConfig.class);

    @Bean
    public CommonErrorHandler kafkaErrorHandler() {
        CommonLoggingErrorHandler handler = new CommonLoggingErrorHandler();

        // Implement the custom logger
        handler.setCommonErrorHandlerLogger((thrownException, data) -> {
            
            // Find the most specific (root) cause
            Throwable rootCause = NestedExceptionUtils.getMostSpecificCause(thrownException);

            // Log the root cause with its full stack trace
            log.error(
                "Error processing Kafka message. Root cause: {}",
                rootCause.getMessage(),
                rootCause
            );
        });

        return handler;
    }
}
